You can create an RelativeStrengthIndex indicator that does not automatically update. This lets you update the indicator with any data you choose. The following reference table describes the RelativeStrengthIndex constructor.

Initializes a new instance of the RelativeStrengthIndex class with the specified name and period.

Parameters
This constructor does not take any argument.

Return

RelativeStrengthIndex - The new RelativeStrengthIndex indicator object.

Definition at line 47 of file Indicators/RelativeStrengthIndex.cs.

Initializes a new instance of the RelativeStrengthIndex class with the specified name and period.

Parameters
This constructor does not take any argument.

Return

RelativeStrengthIndex - The new RelativeStrengthIndex indicator object.

Definition at line 58 of file Indicators/RelativeStrengthIndex.cs.


You can update the indicator automatically or manually.

Automatic Update

Create a consolidator and then call the RegisterIndicator method to update the indicator with the consolidated bars.

private RelativeStrengthIndex _rsi;

// In Initialize()
_rsi = new RelativeStrengthIndex(name, period, movingAverageType);
_rsi.Updated += IndicatorUpdateMethod;

var thirtyMinuteConsolidator = new TradeBarConsolidator(TimeSpan.FromMinutes(30));
var symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;
SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

RegisterIndicator(symbol, _rsi, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

// In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if (_rsi.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _rsi.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.rsi = RelativeStrengthIndex(name, period, movingAverageType)
self.rsi.Updated += self.IndicatorUpdateMethod

thirty_minute_consolidator = TradeBarConsolidator(timedelta(minutes=30))
symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol
self.SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirty_minute_consolidator)

self.RegisterIndicator(symbol, self.rsi, thirty_minute_consolidator)

# In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if self.rsi.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.rsi.Current.Value

Manual Update

Updating your indicator manually enables you to control when the indicator is updated and what data you use to update it. To manually update the indicator, call the Update method that with time/decimal pair. The indicator will only be ready after you prime it with enough data.

private RelativeStrengthIndex _rsi;
private Symbol symbol;

// In Initialize()
_rsi = new RelativeStrengthIndex(name, period, movingAverageType);
symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;

// In OnData()
if (data.ContainsKey(_symbol))
{
    _rsi.Update(data[symbol].EndTime, data[symbol].High);
}
if (_rsi.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _rsi.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.rsi = RelativeStrengthIndex(name, period, movingAverageType)
self.symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol

# In OnData()
if data.ContainsKey(self.symbol):
    self.rsi.Update(data[self.symbol].EndTime, data[self.symbol].High)
if self.rsi.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.rsi.Current.Value
